page.title: 03Life on a rural smallholding
page.content: At 7am mum and dad get up.Dad takes mum to work at the trouser factory in Knighton.Grandad gets up and feeds the animals then goes to the coal yard where he sells and delivers coal.Dad takes me and Chris down to school and Nan comes later to cook the school dinners.Zarina,our neighbour,collects us from school.We play from 3.45 to 5 when Dad fetches Mum.Grandad comes home at about 6.We have a cooked tea and when the washing up is done we help feed and see to all our animals and in summer we work in the garden or help with hay making.In the winter we pulp swedes then we go in and watch television by a nice fire. Then we have milk and biscuits a bath and bed. (20 acre smallholding with 120 sheep, 6 calves, 1 pony and poultry,growing swedes and located on the hills)
